message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

This paper deals with measuring similarity between human motions using deep metric learning, which involves computer vision and machine learning techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes a novel deep architecture based on attentive recurrent neural networks, which falls under the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper uses Maximum Mean Discrepancy, which is a statistical measure, indicating that it could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper deals with analyzing human motion data, which could also fall under cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper uses a triplet-based deep metric learning approach, which is a type of neural network, indicating that it could also belong to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
